page.title: 01STANTON ON HINE HEATH
page.content: { STANTON ON HINE HEATH Stanton is a quiet rural village which comprises a variety of residential properties. The main land use in the area is farming, mainly arable with some cattle rearing. The area incorporates some woodland, scrubland and heathland. Stanton probably derives its name from the latin meaning stoney estate and infact the land is quite stoney and about class two and three for soil goodness. Despite the lack of many recognized facilities, infrequent bus service in parts of the area for example, most inhabitants seem happy with their area and only a few would wish any changes.
